text: Good morning Caitiling it depends on what the domain registrar includes in dns rcords. For example Cloudflare has CDN, while others providers not. i think that the cdn technlogy is usefull.

good morning everybody, i'm trying the best solution for a migration. we have 3 portals with 3 companies, and now they should be migrate in one enterprise portal. the difficulties i found is to separate the objects for the different brand, for example one brand is called A and he must see only his lp, dem wf and contacts, can someone tell me the best way to do this?
Maybe make a property that has a select option for whichever brand the object is related to
Then you can create views for just those companies
You could use the HubDB api
or you could iframe the HubSpot dynamic pages
I honestly really like Cloudflare but really any registrar will get the job done
i also think this is the way, the only problem wee have now is that we can't add the same subdomain to two differents portals, i read on the community that we can do this
Yeah because the dns records would be messed up if you tried to use the same domain for 2 different website
i think we should delete it from the first portal
Correct, you can not use the same domain for 2 different portals
mmm thanks for your help, i think that in the meanwhile of the migration it will be down the blog, and we don't want this. so i need a different solution
